qas.question: What is the cost of primary and secondary education in Namibia?
How many Namibian students were recorded in 1998 in primary school?
How many Namibian students were recorded in 1998 in secondary schools?
What was the pupil-teacher ratio in Namibia in 1999?
What develops the curriculum as well as other educational resources in Namibia?
What is the capital of Namibia?
How many teachers are there in Namibia in primary and secondary schools?
How much of Namibia's GDP is spent on defense?
What was the pupil-teacher ratio in 2000?
What is the population of Okahandja?

context: Namibia has <a0_0>free<a0_0/> education for both Primary and secondary education levels. Grades 1–7 are primary level, grades 8–12 secondary. In 1998, there were <a1_0>400,325<a1_0/> Namibian students in primary school and <a2_0><b6_0><b9_0>115,237<b9_0/><b6_0/><a2_0/> students in secondary schools. The pupil-teacher ratio in 1999 was estimated at <a3_0><b8_0>32:1<b8_0/><a3_0/>, with about <b7_0>8%<b7_0/> of the GDP being spent on education. Curriculum development, educational research, and professional development of teachers is centrally organised by the <a4_0>National Institute for Educational Development<a4_0/> (NIED) in <b5_0>Okahandja<b5_0/>.
